title: Figma Unveils AI-Powered Erase, Isolate, and Expand Tools for Seamless In-App Image Editing

paragraphs.content: Figma launched three new AI-powered tools—Erase object, Isolate object, and Expand image—on December 10, 2025, integrating them into a revamped toolbar in Figma Design and Figma Draw. These features enable precise edits like removing unwanted elements, separating subjects for adjustments such as lighting or blur, and extending backgrounds to new aspect ratios without distortion or exports to tools like Photoshop. Available immediately to Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plan users with AI enabled, they consolidate with existing options like Remove background and Crop for streamlined workflows.

paragraphs.content: The tools prioritize granular control without text prompts, addressing pain points in design, marketing, and product teams by keeping all edits on the Figma canvas. A promotional video demonstrates their efficiency, showing users selecting areas to erase or isolate objects and expand images for formats like mobile banners. Early coverage highlights how these capabilities end the need for juggling multiple design apps, boosting speed during reviews and iterations.

sections.title: Breakdown of Figma's New Image Editing Capabilities

paragraphs.content: Erase object lets users select and vanish unwanted elements using an improved lasso tool, ideal for quick cleanups in mockups or campaigns. Isolate object separates subjects for repositioning or effects like shadow, color, or focus changes while retaining background traits. Expand image fills out borders seamlessly, converting square shots to landscape banners without quality loss.

paragraphs.content: The unified contextual toolbar now centralizes all edits, giving Remove background a prominent spot due to its popularity among designers. Figma positions these as closing workflow loops, eliminating time lost on external edits and re-imports. They join AI image generation for a complete in-app suite, enhancing precision over generative models.

sections.title: Streamlining Workflows for Marketers and Teams

paragraphs.content: ContentGrip notes these tools cut dependencies on design teams for background tweaks, enabling faster test variations and in-house optimizations. TechCrunch emphasizes reduced export hassles, with the lasso upgrade allowing detailed selections for removal or isolation. Figma's blog describes finessing details like device adaptations as now intuitive and contained within the canvas.

Plans call for expanding these features across more Figma products in 2026, building on 150-plus 2025 updates including drawing tools. This rollout caps a year of AI advancements, inviting user feedback via quizzes in release notes. Industry views frame it as evolving Figma into a full visual design hub with assistive, non-disruptive AI.
